messages: 991bf6aaf5469467bcf4fb8943b16ee5 (12:07): I have this 'foot' model, where there is the main base and the four toes in individual meshes. How can i make that into ONE mesh, so I can subsurf it neatly, _and_ move it about as a whole and mirror it to get a left foot also (( I have a right right now ))
a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (12:08): then get back to work
991bf6aaf5469467bcf4fb8943b16ee5 (12:08): raw, Denmark.. I am British though
a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (12:09): hey you have our princess there
c888f3dd6a385becf18970f14086b692 (12:09): if you are adding meshes in endit mode they will be one object
c888f3dd6a385becf18970f14086b692 (12:09): if you add a mesh in object mode it will be a seperate object
c888f3dd6a385becf18970f14086b692 (12:10): i think you now have 4 seperated objects`
c888f3dd6a385becf18970f14086b692 (12:11): next time add new meshes in edit mode... i dont know how to join them to one
c888f3dd6a385becf18970f14086b692 (12:11): try to browse the "mesh" menu and look for a option
c888f3dd6a385becf18970f14086b692 (12:14): join your objects into a single mesh within Blender with Object->Join Objects or Ctrl+J.
c888f3dd6a385becf18970f14086b692 (12:14): tell me if it is working :)
c888f3dd6a385becf18970f14086b692 (12:15): first mark all the objects you want to join
